newsitem.title: AZERBAIJAN: French foreign minister visits Azerbaijan.
newsitem.headline: French foreign minister visits Azerbaijan.

text.p: French Foreign Minister Herve De Charette arrived in Azerbaijan on Tuesday for a brief visit aimed at advancing negotiations over the country's territorial conflict with neighbouring Armenia.
De Charette was to meet his counterpart Hasan Hasanov and President Haydar Aliyev.
He was due to fly onto the Armenian capital Yerevan later in the evening, and will meet with President Levon Ter-Petrosyan on Wednesday, officials said.

An Azerbaijani Foreign Ministry spokesman said the talks would focus on the more than nine-year-long conflict between Moslem Azerbaijan and Christian Armenia over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh.
France is a co-sponsor of peace talks between the two sides under the auspices of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe.
The latest round of negotiations between Azeri and Armenian representatives began on Tuesday in Moscow.
The conflict killed thousands before a 1994 cease-fire came into effect but no lasting settlement has been achieved.
